div.a: How Did This Cat Find Its Way Home From 200 Miles Away?

div.div: Nobody knows how it happened: an indoor housecat who got lost on a family excursion managing, after two months and about 200 miles, to return to her hometown.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XpDtaI&via=Digg&text=How Did This Cat Find Its Way Home From 200 Miles Away?

div.a: Why Is Obama On A Billboard In Iran?

div.div: Tehran's latest propaganda offensive shows Barack Obama on a huge mural side by side with a seventh-century Shia villain.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VG3l5y&via=Digg&text=Why Is Obama On A Billboard In Iran?

div.div: DID CUBA JUST TURN THE INTERNET ON?

In February 2011, the first submarine cable connecting the island nation of Cuba to the global internet (by way of Venezuela) landed on Siboney beach, Santiago de Cuba. In the two years since, the fate of the cable has been a mystery for Cuba observers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xs0n1b&via=Digg&text=Mystery Cable Activated In Cuba

div.a: Stranded On The Roof Of The World

div.div: Afghanistan’s Kyrgyz nomads survive in one of the most remote, high-altitude, bewitching landscapes on Earth. It’s a heavenly life—and a living hell.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X3VTA4&via=Digg&text=Stranded On The Roof Of The World

div.a: How Ramen Transformed From A College Staple To A Culinary Darling

div.div: For years, the word ramen would make most people’s minds immediately go to the instant-noodle variety, so long a staple of dorm rooms and bachelor pads. But these days, the real deal is becoming more and more accessible.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UXGzDk&via=Digg&text=How Ramen Transformed From A College Staple To A Culinary Darling

div.a: The Fed's 2007 Transcripts: How Much They Knew, How Little They Understood

div.div: I had the sense that even as leaders of the central bank projected public calm, and confidence that there would be no recession, that behind closed doors they saw what direction things were heading. It isn’t so.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sfy0GP&via=Digg&text=The Fed's 2007 Transcripts: How Much They Knew, How Little They Understood

div.a: This Is Not A Scene From Blade Runner

div.div: You probably have seen the extreme smog in Beijing, so bad that you can observe it from space. But this shot blew my mind just because it looks like a frame from Blade Runner. So awesome—if you don't live there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XMUxKC&via=Digg&text=This Is Not A Scene From Blade Runner

div.a: World's 100 Richest Earned Enough In 2012 To End Global Poverty 4 Times Over

div.div: The world's 100 richest people earned a stunning total of $240 billion in 2012 – enough money to end extreme poverty worldwide four times over.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WfEdjq&via=Digg&text=World's 100 Richest Earned Enough In 2012 To End Global Poverty 4 Times Over

div.div: TWO FOR THE PRICE OF ONE

div.a: Man Cracks Open Massive Egg To Discover Another Egg Inside

div.div: I’m going to take a moment to interrupt your normal/art design programming with this absurd video from a gentleman who discovered an enormous egg amongst the daily collection of eggs from his farm.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UYenAc&via=Digg&text=Man Cracks Open Massive Egg To Discover Another Egg Inside

div.div: AIN'T NO PARTY LIKE A PRESIDENTIAL PARTY

div.a: Inaugural Hijinks: 10 Odd Photos From Ceremonies Past

div.div: As we prepare for President Obama's second inauguration on Monday, a look back at a few funny and unusual moments.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdpYkj&via=Digg&text=Inaugural Hijinks: 10 Odd Photos From Ceremonies Past

div.div: A KOALA BEAR ISN'T REALLY A BEAR
We live with half-truths — of varying kinds and sizes. A year is not always 365 days. A billable hour is not necessarily 60 minutes. Pluto isn't precisely a planet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XncNYZ&via=Digg&text=12 Half-Truths We Live With

div.div: DOES NOT HAVE SUPER POWERS (WE THINK)

div.a: Meet Mike, The Most Radioactive Fish Ever From Fukushima

div.div: Almost two years after the awful nuclear disaster occurred, a fish caught near Fukushima on Friday January 18th had a record-breaking level of radioactive contamination over 2500x the legal limit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13QV95a&via=Digg&text=Meet Mike, The Most Radioactive Fish Ever From Fukushima

div.div: All I really need to know about fear I learned in elementary school. Before I ever saw a horror film, I had acquired an extensive knowledge of the genre’s main visual icons.

div.a: How 4 Years Have Changed The Obamas

div.div: Barack and Michelle Obama have spent more than a thousand days on display before the nation’s eyes, but the personal changes they have undergone can be hard to detect.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10aU1po&via=Digg&text=How 4 Years Have Changed The Obamas

div.a: Man Posts To Facebook: 'I'm About To Get Shot'; Gets Shot

div.div: Shortly after an alleged crime spree, a Michigan man takes out his cell phone and announces his fate on Facebook. It comes to pass very quickly.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ws1pvz&via=Digg&text=Man Posts To Facebook: 'I'm About To Get Shot'; Gets Shot

div.a: The Man Who Got To Be President For A Day

div.div: What would happen if the President, perhaps due to religious convictions, refused to take the oath on a Sunday. Well it happened before, perhaps.
